Dear Trish and Joel,

Thankyou!!!! All working perfectly!!!

You guys are tops.

Happy Friday!

😊

Fi

Thanks so much Joel and it's completely fine re the delay, I am assuming you guys are as busy as us.

Fiona can you please test.

Thanks so much

Cheers

Trish

Hi Petricia,

Sorry for the delay. Confirming we have updated the find the trials. Let me know if this works for you? 
https://mstrials.org.au/find-an-ms-trial/?status=closed&form=Relapsing%20Remitting%20MS

Hi Joel

Wondering how you are tracking with the additional issue Fiona identified?

Thanks

Trish

Dear Trish and Joel,

The trial location button now works as requested-THANKYOU! 😊.

Unfortunately this is allowing me to see that the Recruitment status button is NOT working.

Eg if I select Recruitment Status: Closed, I get no trials, even though there are examples of closed trials in there, eg: "Mindful or mind full? An eight week program for people with multiple sclerosis".

Many thanks for any help you can provide please Joel for this second issue?

Best wishes

Fiona

Thanks Joel.

Fiona can you please test that this is now working for you.

Thank you

Trish

Thanks so much

From: Fiona McKay <fmckay@msra.org.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 18 August 2020 12:03 PM
To: Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au>
Subject: Issue with the MS Trials Website


Dear Trish,


A user of the MS Trials Site found that if they select any other "Recruitment Status" than "All", they get no studies returned on a trial search.


I double checked and confirmed this is the case using Google Chrome.


Could you let me know how I should follow up/fix this please?


Many thanks
Fi


From: Fiona McKay
Sent: Tuesday, 18 August 2020 11:39 AM
To: 'pelleter@gmail.com' <pelleter@gmail.com>
Subject: FW: New submission from the MS Trials contact page


Dear Benjamin,


Many thanks for contacting us and alerting us to this problem with the site.


My apologies for the inconvenience, and I will follow up with our IT people.


In the meantime, using Google Chrome it seems that the Recruitment Status button is the problem. So if you search your State and RRMS, that should limit the number of studies you need to scroll through in the interim.


Best wishes
Fiona

My work hours are 9AM - 3PM, Mon - Fri, others by appointment.
Fiona McKay, PhD
Research Development Coordinator
MS Research Australia
02 8413 7922 • 1300 356 467
fmckay@msra.org.au• www.msra.org.au
Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060









From: MS Trials Website <mstrials@msra.org.au>
Sent: Saturday, 15 August 2020 10:35 PM
To: MS Research Australia Trials <mstrials@msra.org.au>
Subject: New submission from the MS Trials contact page


Title

Mr
First Name

Benjamin
Surname

Pettit
Email

pelleter@gmail.com
Enquiry

Your trial search filter is broken for me, if I select a state or recruitment status while selecting RRMS it does not show any trials. I need to select ALL, ALL and RRMS to see many pages and then manually search through.
